intro: Anthemis armeniaca, commonly known as Armenian chamomile, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers with white centers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features linear, grass-like leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported calming and anti-inflammatory properties.
